Reviews.Title: “Don'tstayinthisdump.com”
Reviews.Author: Theo P
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of "treating" my wife to a midweek London break staying at the Limegrove Hotel, Warwick Way. This bed and breakfast is not only filthy (and as an ex soldier I have slept in trenches), the decor is dated and in need of help. The "full english" breakfast consists a rubber egg and two dried out bacon rashers, cardboard toast (on plastic plates), tea and marmalade. The en-suite is so small that you have to poo with the door open, unless you walk into the filthy shower first. Don't ask for a cup of tea, it's not included in the price apparently and "no sir, we don't do that!" was their reply. Their is a beautiful whiff of sewage on entry, which you do get used to once you have managed to open your window, which is held open by a piece of wood. All in all our midweek trip to London was a success, the Limegrove unfortunately, was not! Should you have plans to stay here, please, please don't. I would not wish this on a homeless person whose only alternative was a shop doorway in Afghanistan.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t stay there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karl W
Reviews.Content: I´ve been there for 3 nights, and I would refuse to put one foot in there again. It was dirty, even the bedding I could´nt use the blanket, it seemd I could allready see all those little animals one doesn´t want to think about it. The breakfast was a joke, they call it roomservice but only if the whole house is packed and there is simply no space left. The shower and toilets are disgusting, I preferd to use the public toilets at Victoria Station....The whole house would need a complete updating and new management. I had seen such places before on the telly in "homes from hell".

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here, don't stay here, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: holidaygal136
Reviews.Content: i booked this before reading trip advisor - big mistake. But i always like to give everything a chance and make my own mind up. I was wrong to do this. I've stayed in poor places before but this was awful. The staff are lovely, pleasant and cheerful but that is all that i can say that is positive. When the front door is opened there is an awful smell that hits you. This is musty and strong. The carpets are mismatched, threadbare right through to the floor in parts and cabels run under them in parts. The walls and skirting have not seen paint in a long time. This is especially evident with the cracks that have been repaired really showing up the dirt. Of course there are cracks and areas of disrepair that have not been touched. The carpet in my bedroom was stained and the blanket on the bed was ripped and obviously very old and worn done. The cloth headboards on the beds were stained. The furniture in my bedroom did not fit and therefore a chest of drawers just sat in the middle of the already tiny space. The furniture was mismatched and badly worn resembling furniture found in second hand charity shops. The ensuit bathroom (which had been built into the room) was slightly better, obviously more modern but smelt bad and the shower dripped constantly, so much so the cleaners had to keep a towel on the floor to mop up the extra water that splashed over. There was so much stale water in the shower pipe that when having a shower the shower pan would completely fill with water. I attempted to change hotels but no where close had any room and for good reason they all looked lovely and clean and fresh. I resorted to buying Febreeze and air freshners and airing my room daily and even tho i only used this as a base to sleep in it was becoming depressing to return to each evening. The cleaners worked hard every day as my room was neat as a pin & my bathroom clean when i returned but it made no difference to the years of ingrained dirt. Please save yourself any heartache and do not book this hotel. Despite how nice it looks from the outside and how pleasant the staff are it will not change the fact this building has been seriously neglected and the bedroom i saw was horribly depressing and the whole building internally looks and smells bad. It's a real shame because the location is amazing. Don't even stay here for one night, it is not nice. A family left and booked into the hotel next door, i was jealous as they got the last room meaning i couldn't get booked in. tiny space. The furniture was hat have

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful !”
Reviews.Author: andyw0106
Reviews.Content: Room number 8 we stayed in. The bedding was dirty the carpets were filthy and the full english breakfast contained two pieces of dry bacon and one egg ! Please dont stay here !

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: pammy91011
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night we were on a theatre break..you have to pay up front so if you decide not to stay your loss their gain no refund... we found it basically clean... but not comfortable very very cramped we had a triple room and a double room there were 5 of us, one of the beds in the triple was broken the en-suite must be the smallest in London...the whole of the " Hotel?" was cramped we could not pass in the entrance only room for one..the decor is very dated and tired it needs seriously decorating and a change of furniture,the double room was near the entrance my daughter had little sleep with people knocking the door ringing the bell through out the night and general noise, breakfast was not what we expected.. room service beacuse they have no where for a dining room one chair in the room for 3 people we had to sit on the bed... hard egg bacon and toast tea coffee or not very nice orange juice. would we stay again no.I do not think it should be classed as a hotel it is a very basic overnight accomodation not even a b&b.

Reviews.Title: “Vacancy for Chambermaid!”
Reviews.Author: shmdugan
Reviews.Content: I hope to offer a fair, rather than emotive review, of our experiences of this hotel. After getting stuck in London due to half a centimetre of snow we were forced to find a place to stay for the night. This hotel was not our first choice but by this time in the middle of the night we reluctantly approached the door. After waiting several minutes for somebody to appear we were finally let into the hotel. It is quite unlike any hotel I have ever been to. There is no reception. Rather, a reasonably polite man informed us that he only had one room left, that it was a twin budget room and that the cost would be Â£55 for the night including breakfast. At least point we should have appreciated the literal nature of his statement. To be fair to the manageress, who by this time had appeared, she did offer to show us the room prior to our commiting. Rejecting this offer was a major error on our part, for if we had seen the room we simply would have left post haste. They took our money, and rather than being shown to our room were simply told it is 'up the stairs'. We negotiated the frankly unstable staircase without any help with our luggage and unlocked room 9. At this point it is worth noting that we are not unrealistic with what we expect a budget hotel to offer; there are however certain things that should be taken as given: 1. the hotel and room are clean 2. the hotel and room are well maintained 3. the hotel and room should be bug free We entered into the room which was like walking back in time 50 years - fine if clean! The carpet was filthy, the furnature was ready to collapse, the ceiling had damp and had started to fall in on the room. In the corner there were holes and damp which I assume are the reason for the myriad of bugs, beetles and other disgusting creatures crawling over every surface in the room. All over the sink, the wardrobe, the bed, the walls, the ceiling, were large beetles scampering. At this point I decided, for my myself and by this point a very distraught fiancee, that this was not going to be conducive to an even reasonable nights sleep and so took all our luggage back downstairs and rang the front door bell eagerly waiting assistance. I explained to the man that we had entered the room to find it infested with pests, that it was unacceptable and that I demanded a full refund immediately. He went to find the manageress who seemed genuinely quite surprised and concerend, and said that we could indeed obtain the refund we sought. They then went upstairs to check the room, at which point another older man who I can only assume was the owner appeared and started to apologise profusely. He informed us that the hotel normally maintains very high standards of cleanliness, as demonstrated by the fact that their entrance had been cleared of snow! I informed him that the cleanliness of the hotel, and any staffing issues they may be currently be having were his problem and not mine, and that all I was interested in at that point was obtaining a refund. The whole (I assume family) were very polite about the ordeal and indeed gave us the refund. They insisted that they are having issues with the cleaner and that this is contrary to their usual standard, indeed their was an advert in the window for a chambermaid! So to offer something of a summary - the hotel was in a disgusting state. From a budget hotel I do not expect luxurary but I do expect it to be clean. To be fair to the management they dealt with it considerately, however I would not recommend that anyone stay here. In line with previous reviews on this site that go back to as early as 2004, the hotel seems far from being fit for purpose. I have noticed that the manageress is keen to put down any criticism of the hotel, but with so many bad reviews this seems to only make her efforts appear unjustified. The management clearly have not taken notice of reviews. The response 'we do all we can to keep the hotel clean' is not good enough. It should rather read 'we do keep the hotel clean'. This was definatly the worst hotel I have come across.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: richard_taw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Limegrove Hotel, Victoria for 3 nights (just this week) Not very far from Victoria bus and train stations (plenty of shops and food). The place is good, clean and neat. Room had good heating (in winter) and hot water running for bathing. Tours and maps are available easily. Wonderful part was breakfast was served in our rooms â€“ our first experience. That means we could have the breakfast at our timing. Staff is very obliging â€“ carried my heavy luggage right up to our room (cannot find this in B & B) and the owner (husband and wife team) were very hospitable and very friendly. I will not hesitate to stay there when I visit LON again. It was truly a good place to stay. Recommend this place to travellers to LON Victoria any time. - Richard & Peggy - Dec 2010

Reviews.Title: “Location is probably the only thing that is good about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: julianort
Reviews.Content: 101 WARWICK Keep in mind there are two "Limegrove" hotels in London, this review is for Limegrove on 101 Warwick Way, near Victoria. LOCATION As I said in the title, this is the best thing about this hotel. It is located on a quiet street full of B&Bs and hotels, withing walking distance of Victoria Underground and coach station. Plenty of excellent restaurants & cafes nearby, as well as a grocery store. Felt safe when walking after dark. DECOR & ATMOSPHERE The hotel is in a need of full renovation. The carpet on the stairs is worn, the stairs themselves screak, the rooms are filled with mismatched furniture picked up God knows where. Doors are flimzy, and single-pane windows let cold air in. Folks who stay in the hotel are traveling on a budget, obviously, BUT the hotel management also does something that other hotels may not do - it lets in people from the street without reservation. And I literally mean from the street. They do it for the sake of cashflow and don't really care about the reputation of the hotel. I witnessed a gentleman who couldn't pay upfront and begged to stay until morning when he could go to Victoria to exchange his foreign currency to GBP. EN-SUITE ROOM Anyway, I had the misfortune of booking their en-suite room on the ground level. The room was located right at the entrance to the hotel, next to the hotel's telephone, pay phone, door buzzer and, of course, had a very flimzy door with zero sound attenuation. It was especially bad when someone came in around midnight or 1:00 am and was talking loudly about the room rates. I used earplugs all nights. TO MANAGEMENT: Folks, please, move the door buzzer down to your own quarters and don't let guests enjoy it in the middle of the night. Let your guests sleeeeep. The owners are going totally on the cheap by providing only one towel per room, and only one bar of soap. Nothing else. The en-suite shower was tiny and meant for people shorter than 5'10" (180 cm) tall. The air in the shower was damp and had a bad smell about it. The carpets on the floor were dirty, and so was the bed cover. I had no choice but to trust that the bed linens were OK. A huge draft of cold air was coming in from an old window which had NO lock on it. It was cold during the night (it's November, people!) ROOM WITH SHARED BATH I then was moved to their room with shared bath on the upper floors. That room was nicer and had a modern plastic window frame installed some time ago. In its day, the frame may have been nice, but now it got out of whack, could be barely closed properly and again let some cool air in. The carpet on the floor was probably never vacuumed. At this point, I thought that perhaps the cleaning crew doesn't like to haul the vacuum cleaner up and down the stairs? There was a wash basin in the room with... ta-da!.... only cold water in it. Nice touch in the morning when you are trying to brush your teeth after having some hot coffee. I was squeamish and after seeing the carpets didn't use the shared bathroom. INTERNET Bring your own ethernet cable - there are jacks in the room and the connection supposed to be free, but management wants 10GBP deposit for using their ethernet cable. BREAKFAST It was OK. Too much fried bacon though. Do try one of the bakeries on Wilton st. nearby - they have oh so yummy stuff. RECOMMENDATIONS If you're staying in Londong for the first time, DON'T stay here as it will spoil the whole trip. If you need to sleep 1 (one) night and don't care much about the atmosphere/cleanliness, it may do. The management of this hotel really needs to realize that location is the key to developing this place. It has potential, but needs investment to develop into something worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Serrelongue
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel on a number of occasions over the past few months. Situated close to Victoria - very handy for me and no doubt for many others too. This hotel is very friendly - family owned and run - and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Saved my Trip - Twice!”
Reviews.Author: garnitchique
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 6:30am in rainy London after a rough night on a bus is not exactly a great pleasure. Hunting down a hotel room even less. Luckily I found Limegrove Hotel, which allowed me to check in immediately, take a shower and rest a bit before I had to go for my meeting at 9am. Its very close to Victoria Station in a lovely neighborhood. For 35 Pounds a basic breakfast was served to the simple & clean room the next day â€“ Nice! Joyce is a very friendly host too â€“ she was very helpful and friendly when I lost essential travel documents.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comforable value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandBraveheart
Reviews.Content: LOCATION IS GREAT A FEW MINUTES WALK FROM VICTORIA BUS AND TRAIN STATION AND GATWICK EXPRESS. IF HAD HAD WENT BY THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS ON THIS SITE I WOULD HAVE MISSED OUT. WHAT PLANET DO PEOPLE LIVE ON? The room was very comfortable and cosy and warm. Why would i want to stay in a globo hotel with no character or a hostel full of drunken backpackers? Here i slept really well ,had my breakfast served to me in bed and was always asked if i was comfortable enough. Owners Nick and Joyce are fantastic people who went out of their way to help which in my experience can be rare in London. My expectations were exceeded and i will be going back, great service & excellent stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Simpaty and effective service”
Reviews.Author: PeterRedRiver
Reviews.Content: The reception was very kind and helpful; the room was very acceptable for this kind of hotel, as well as the technical installations. The Hotel is situated in a good and central position in London. It's simple to take the underground or Bus to visit the city. The staff is more jovial and caring. In my opinion for the tourist that want a nice price hotel but with all the services I suggest this choice. We will be back to Limegrove. See you soon. Pedro, Bernardo e JoÃ£o - Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Limegrove was quite good at all”
Reviews.Author: Tonius
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was surprised in a comfortable way because I also was sceptical after reading reviews when I had booked a room at Limegrove. The reception was very kind and helpful, the room was very acceptable for this kind of hotel, as well as the technical installations. ItÂ´s that kind of "London charme" that I have learned to know several times before and which I am content with for this price. The location is superb, Victoria Station round the corner, a very good starting point for tourists. After all, I enjoyed staying there for three nights,

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: packabagbaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with the advice from a travel book. Also, it was a good central location. While the neighborhood and location is good and close to Victoria Coach Station, the B and B was so bad. We entered thru this tiny corridor where we were checked in, there is no lobby-just you, all your luggage and a bunch of other people cramped against the wall. Then we were shown to our room in the basement. Our bathroom down the hall. I've stayed in other B and B's in London and even in a lower floor but never in one that really felt like the basement! We had fold up medal chairs in the room and when I put my clothes in the wardrobe closet, the door fell off the hinges. We were so tired after traveling and wanted to rest but the room depressed us so much we decided to go out anyway. The breakfast was the worst -we will never stay there again and can't believe that any book would recommend the place. They need to clean up their act.

Reviews.Title: “Good for London on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: KiwiColorado87
Reviews.Content: We were a Kiwi American family traveling on a budget to Europe and stayed at the Limegrove for 4 nights in September 08. For the price this modest B&B was acceptable and more than met our expecatations. Our room was clean and roomy - if somewhat sparse and threadbare (a little like the rest of the B&B). The beds were old - but firm and reasonably comfortable. The shower in our room didn't work - but as we were not expecting in room facilities that was fine. The location is central and very convenient - 5-10 mins walk from Victoria Station. For the price and for those who are there to enjoy and explore London (and are really only looking for a place to sleep,) this was fine. Just set your expectations correctly.

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfrisen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in a good and central position in London. It's simple to take the Tube or Bus to visit the city. The staff is more jovial and caring. In my opinion for the turist that want a cheap hotel but with all the services I suggest this choice. Cristiano Frisenda, Cellist

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive at best”
Reviews.Author: ClunkClunk
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for five nights in April. To say the least, this place was unimpressive. I've noticed it's reviews have significantly dropped in ratings since I last checked TripAdvisor, and rightfully so. Here are the good things I can say about this place - the owners/management are relatively pleasant. The breakfast was decent enough, but nothing spectacular. The location wasn't too bad. A brisk 10 minute walk to Victoria station. The bad things are pretty extensive. Nothing horrific, as we decided to stay in it for our 5 days, though mostly because we pre-paid, and it was frankly, just more convenient than finding a new place to stay in our price range (we're students, and money is fairly tight). I won't go over what others have reviewed, but they're spot on. The place is extremely poorly maintained. Simple things like removing stains from carpeting, keeping the bathroom clean, keeping junk and objects (vacuums) out of the common passageways, are just signs to me that no one puts the effort or care that is needed to make this place passable. Little things that take minimal effort, like drilling holes to run the cable TV lines in to each room, instead of running them under the window sill causing cold air to leak in are just laziness. Another complaint I have is on the topic of appropriate conversation between guests and staff. While I appreciate friendly conversation, assuming simply because we're Americans that we support and enjoy the actions of our president and government is a bit short sighted. This gentleman who works here not only took the time to try to share his love for Bush to myself and my girlfriend one evening, he also brought the topic up immediately with my girlfriend's sister when she dropped by to meet up with us, as he realized she was also an American. Overall, this hotel has a lot of potential, but is suffering greatly from being very poorly run. It's shabby and not worth the money. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “booking at limegrove hotel”
Reviews.Author: andderalz
Reviews.Content: I would like to caution anyone making a reservation with limegrove hotel, which we did, and then have to cancel, in our case for a health related issue. Unlike most other hotels, B&B's, there is no published cancellation policy. Be sure to ask for one in writing, and you will find that they do not refund. They will try to talk you into paying in full for the nights you are there as "that is the only way we can guarantee the room for those nights". We managed to get three out of the four nights refunded and are still going through our Bank to recover the 4th night. Dealing with this hotel was a really unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “strange breakfast procedure”
Reviews.Author: Adam-Chance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Limegrove Hotel Victoria and agree with the reviewer from Toronto, I found the breakfast procedure bizarre, you are asked on arrival whether you would like a continental or cooked breakfast for the next morning, when it arrives (separately to the other sharer in the same room) it is minimal and orange juice is only served with the continental version. Its not worth waiting for. The shared bathroom in the corridor had mould and made me shudder, one of the other reviews here which I feel is a management review, mentions the building is listed so they 'cant do things with the building' ? being listed or in a conservation area does'nt mean you cant have a really nice place. This has'nt prevented the many partioned studwork walls from from being put up and adds to poor sound insulation. This hotel has a hostel/instituion/shabby student feel and look, but could have such great potential. There seems to be another Limegrove hotel in W12. This review is about the Limegrove Hotel Warwick Way. Victoria London SE1

Reviews.Title: “The Slimegrove Hotel - SORRY B+B”
Reviews.Author: FOOFIGHTER1
Reviews.Content: This is firstly not a hotel - it is the worst bed and breafast ever- I actually couldnt believe these people are allowed to trade. On arriving to this pleace we were kept aiting in the smallerst corridoor for about 25 mins whilst the lady washed her hands- we were then shown our room- myself and partmer were in a double and our friend in a single- the double room STANK of a sweet -sickly smell it had a double bed and a single so there was no room to swing a cat- the bedding was filthy - the window had to be held open by a bin, there was no fire escape- unfortunte for our friend who had a room in the basement- the lights didnt work so henearly fell down the stairs- he was advised that the keys to his room left with the last customer so he could have the spare pair- he refused to sleep in this windowless void and bunked up with us. The bathroon- it was tiny with a shower cubicle init growing mould- wet towel on the floor and no toilet roll- i mearly cried when i saw the place- a complete rip off. be warned pay a but extra and stay somewhere clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing, dreary and altogether awful.”
Reviews.Author: Diva4Nomar
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review on anything but I felt compelled I had to write one about the Limegrove Hotel. Although the manageress, Joyce, is quite nice to you over email and over the phone, she turns into a different person once you are in her B&B. The staff is neither pleasant nor helpful; breakfast is a joke, but more importantly the rooms are neglected, cramped and dusty, and the W. C. is moldy, and, overall, the rooms are in a very sad state. Iâ€™m pretty sure the rooms have not been dusted in a few years. Overall, this place is not worth it, even if you are saving a few pounds. What upset us the most is that you have to pay upfront for your stay. So if you don't like the B&B you're screwed! If you truly, truly need to save money and are on a budget, I'd suggest the Premier Travel Inn in County Hall. That's where we ended up staying our last night in London and now I wished we would have stayed there the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, uncomfortable, dirty, depressing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night - pretty bad really - uncomfortable and noisy. I ended up with bites all over me from what I can only assume were bed bugs. Breakfast was 1 hour late and when it finally arrived it was pretty unappealing - 1 rasher of bacon, 1 partly uncooked sausage and a soggy egg. I wouldn't recommend here - I have stayed in much nicer youth hostels for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “lumpy bed, noisy, poor service”
Reviews.Author: David_Crimmond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Limegrove Hotel in March of 2006. We would not recommend this hotel. When we arrived we were required to pay for our three nights upfront and in cash. The sign on the hotel advertises â€œhot and cold waterâ€�. We were surprised to learn that itâ€™s meant literally and that the hot water is only available at certain times in the morning and evening! (Although we always managed to have a hot shower.) Our room with en suite bathroom on the top floor was cramped and in need of some renovation. The bed was very uncomfortable, lumpy and with springs. We ordered the continental breakfast for the next day which is delivered to the room between 7:30 and 8:30. Our breakfast came on time but was so unappealing that we decided not to order it the next day. We told the manager that we didnâ€™t want to be disturbed the next morning and that we would like to skip the breakfast. The next day we were woken up at 7:30 by the maid entering our room without knocking and asking us if we wanted breakfast! An hour later the same maid came back with the breakfast we did not order and disturbed us once more. We complained about this yet the next day we were again woken up with a breakfast we specifically declined. The toilet in the hallway also kept us up, sounding like a rocket taking off when it was flushed. We would advise anyone wanting to be comfortable and get a little sleep to search elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Limegrove Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 101 Warwick Way, London SW1V 1QL, England
